title: Deadly, sombre Good Friday as 58 people killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza
snippets: Palestinian Christians in Gaza and the occupied West Bank are holding temperate gatherings leading up to Easter.
titles: Deadly, sombre Good Friday as 58 people killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza
summary: Palestinian Christians in Gaza and the occupied West Bank are observing Easter with subdued celebrations. These gatherings, held in anticipation of Easter, reflect the community's current circumstances and are characterized by a more restrained observance of the holiday.

title: One dead after protests against KFC branches in Pakistan
snippets: Protesters, angry at the war in Gaza, have claimed KFC is a symbol of the United States and its ally Israel.
titles: One dead after protests against KFC branches in Pakistan
summary: Protesters, expressing anger over the war in Gaza, have targeted KFC, labeling it as a symbol of the United States and its support for Israel. This reflects broader discontent with American foreign policy and its implications in the region.

title: Ukraine minerals deal may not buy peace after Trump threat
snippets: As Trump threatens to walk from peace talks, a mineral deal looks unlikely to offer Ukraine security.
titles: Ukraine minerals deal may not buy peace after Trump threat
summary: Former President Trump has indicated a potential withdrawal from peace negotiations, casting doubt on the prospects of a mineral deal that was considered a potential security assurance for Ukraine. This development suggests that the anticipated agreement, aimed at bolstering Ukraine's security, may not materialize as hoped.

title: At least two killed in Israeli strikes on southern Lebanon
snippets: Israel has continued to conduct near-daily strikes in Lebanon despite a ceasefire with Hezbollah last November.
titles: At least two killed in Israeli strikes on southern Lebanon
summary: Despite a ceasefire agreement with Hezbollah in November, Israel has persisted in carrying out near-daily airstrikes in Lebanon. This ongoing military action underscores the continued tensions and conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, despite the formal ceasefire.

title: Did Xi Jinping succeed in winning support against Trump’s tariff war?
snippets: Chinese president visits three Southeast Asian nations amid global uncertainty.
titles: Did Xi Jinping succeed in winning support against Trump’s tariff war?
summary: The Chinese president embarked on a diplomatic tour, visiting three Southeast Asian countries to strengthen ties amid global uncertainty. This move underscores China's efforts to bolster regional relationships and expand its influence in Southeast Asia, reflecting the nation's strategic interests in the face of international challenges.

title: Joel Dahmen sets 36-hole tournament record in Dominican Republic and leads by 4
snippets: Joel Dahmen played bogey-free for the second straight day for a 6-under 66 to set the 36-hole record at the Corales Puntacana Championship and build a four-shot lead going into the weekend at the site of his only PGA Tour victory.  Dahmen won the tournament in 2021, and another victory would be a boost.  It won't get him into the Masters next year, but Dahmen narrowly kept his PGA Tour card last year and winning is worth a two-year exemption.
titles: Joel Dahmen sets 36-hole tournament record in Dominican Republic and leads by 4
summary: Joel Dahmen set a 36-hole record at the Corales Puntacana Championship with a bogey-free 6-under 66, leading by four shots into the weekend. This event marks the site of his only PGA Tour win in 2021. While a victory here wouldn't qualify him for the Masters, it offers a significant opportunity for Dahmen, who narrowly retained his PGA Tour card last year, as winning grants a two-year exemption on the Tour.

title: BREAKING: Texas picks up coveted Cal TE through transfer portal
snippets: Filling a position of need, the Texas Longhorns have gotten a commitment from Cal TE Jack Endries through the transfer portal.
titles: BREAKING: Texas picks up coveted Cal TE through transfer portal
summary: The Texas Longhorns have secured a commitment from Cal tight end Jack Endries via the transfer portal. This move addresses a position of need for the team.

title: Cubs prevail in wild 13-11 win over Diamondbacks that saw 16 runs scored in eighth inning
snippets: Chicago plated 11 runs in the seventh and eighth innings combined, while Arizona put up a 10-spot in the eighth
titles: Cubs prevail in wild 13-11 win over Diamondbacks that saw 16 runs scored in eighth inning
summary: In a high-scoring baseball game, Chicago and Arizona combined for a total of 21 runs in the seventh and eighth innings alone. Chicago scored 11 runs during these innings, while Arizona contributed 10 runs in the eighth inning. This surge in scoring significantly impacted the game's outcome.

title: Southern wins 2nd straight area championship
snippets: OAKLAND — After compiling a 24-3 record and finishing as state runner-up for a second straight year, Southern was the runaway pick to repeat as Area champion. The Rams, who went unbeaten in the area, were unanimously selected by a panel of local sportswriters. “It’s really cool,” Southern head coach Landon Todd said, “especially to be outright Area champs after splitting (votes) with Mountain ...
titles: Southern wins 2nd straight area championship
summary: Southern's football team, after achieving a 24-3 record and being state runner-up two years in a row, was unanimously chosen by local sportswriters to repeat as Area champions. The team had a perfect record in their area. Head coach Landon Todd expressed pride in the team's recognition as outright Area champs, especially following a previous year of shared votes.

title: Shohei Ohtani away from the Los Angeles Dodgers for birth of his first child
snippets: Shohei Ohtani is away from the Los Angeles Dodgers for the birth of the two-way superstar's first child.  Manager Dave Roberts said before the Dodgers' series opener Friday night in Texas that Ohtani was with his wife and going on MLB's paternity list.  The 30-year-old Ohtani posted on his Instagram account in late December that he and his 28-year-old wife, a former professional basketball player from his native Japan, were expecting a baby in 2025.
titles: Shohei Ohtani away from the Los Angeles Dodgers for birth of his first child
summary: Shohei Ohtani, a key player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, has been placed on MLB's paternity list to be with his wife for the birth of their first child. Manager Dave Roberts confirmed Ohtani's absence before the series opener in Texas. Ohtani, 30, had previously announced on Instagram that he and his 28-year-old wife, a former professional basketball player from Japan, were expecting their baby in 2025.

title: Wall Street slashes stock market forecasts amid Trump tariff fears
snippets: Banks expect gain of just 2% for S&P 500 this year, with JPMorgan and BofA among those lowering estimates
titles: Wall Street slashes stock market forecasts amid Trump tariff fears
summary: Several banks, including JPMorgan and Bank of America, have revised their forecasts for the S&P 500, now expecting a modest gain of just 2% for the year. This adjustment reflects a more cautious outlook on the stock market's growth potential.

title: Trump will abandon Ukraine peace talks ‘in days’ without progress, warns Rubio
snippets: Warning comes after Emmanuel Macron hosted US, Ukraine and other allies for round of negotiations
titles: Trump will abandon Ukraine peace talks ‘in days’ without progress, warns Rubio
summary: After hosting a series of negotiations with the US, Ukraine, and other allies, French President Emmanuel Macron issued a warning. The discussions, which took place recently, aimed to address and potentially resolve ongoing international concerns, although the specific details of the warning were not disclosed in the provided information.

title: Which American Jobs Are Most Likely To Be Affected As China Responds To Trump's Tariffs?
snippets:
KEY TAKEAWAYS

  • An escalating trade war with China, where one of the U.S.'s top trading partners placed a 125% tariff on American goods, will likely make it more expensive for American companies to export products to China.
  • American companies will likely slow hiring, and Trump's tariffs are expected to reduce manufacturing employment by 500,000.
  • The trade war will most likely impact farmers and agriculture companies, as the majority of the $150 billion in goods the U.S. exports to China, is made up of agricultural products.


Exports to China support thousands of U.S. jobs, and economists say those positions could be at risk if trade tensions between the two countries continue.

In an escalating trade war with China, the U.S. has a tariff of 145% on Chinese goods, and China has placed a tariff of 125% on U.S. goods. Economists say these trade tensions will likely make it more expensive for American businesses to import and export Chinese goods and could threaten the labor market.

According to a report by the U.S.-China Business Council, in 2022, an estimated 931,231 American jobs were supported by exports to China. However, hiring and jobs in sectors most exposed to Chinese trade could be in danger if the two countries cannot reach a long-term trade deal and elevated tariffs persist.

A trade war could negatively impact American workers in sectors that rely on exports to China
Sector Jobs
Oilseeds and Grains178,736
Education117,161
Meat Products32,396
Aerospace Products and Parts28,963
Semiconductors and Components28,791
Miscellaneous Crops28,391
Pharmaceuticals and Medicines26,081
Industrial Machinery24,373
Navigational and Measuring Instruments22,961
Motor Vehicles21,873
Oil and Gas21,187
Medical Equipment and Supplies20,929
Miscellaneous Personal and Recreational18,636
Royalties from Industrial Processes16,286
Miscellaneous Business, Professional & Technology Services14,974
Pulp and Paperboard Mill Products13,274
Miscellaneous General Purpose Machinery12,678
Petroleum and Coal Products12,011
Personal Travel and Tourism11,470
Basic Chemicals11,404

Tariffs have not hit the labor market yet; in March, few private-sector companies reported large-scale layoffs. However, as Trump's back-and-forth tariffs continue to create uncertainty, Goldman Sachs economists say hiring will likely be the first economic element to feel the effects.

Chinese Tariffs On US Exports Could Hurt Farmers, Ranchers Most

More than one-fourth of the jobs that could be affected by Chinese tariffs on U.S. goods rely on agricultural trade with China. Farmers are worried they won't be able to afford to sell to their previous trading partners. That could potentially, in turn, affect how they hire and fire workers.

"Farmers Union has always fought for fair trading relationships with other countries," said Rob Larew, president of the National Farmers Union, in a statement on April 2. "We rely on stable markets and fair competition to thrive, but the administration’s actions today create instability at the expense of our family farmers."

The Trump administration has discussed some emergency aid to farmers, as it did during its trade war with China in 2018, according to the New York Times. However, no aid has been put in place yet.
titles: Which American Jobs Are Most Likely To Be Affected As China Responds To Trump's Tariffs?
summary: The escalating trade war between the U.S. and China, marked by a 125% Chinese tariff on U.S. goods and a 145% U.S. tariff on Chinese goods, threatens American jobs, particularly in sectors dependent on exports to China. An estimated 931,231 American jobs, notably in agriculture, could be at risk due to increased costs for American businesses and potential hiring slowdowns. Despite the absence of large-scale layoffs as of March, economic analysts warn that the ongoing uncertainty could soon impact hiring. Farmers, who are significantly affected by these tariffs, fear the loss of affordable acce

title: Dubai chocolate sparks pistachio shortage as TikTokers go nuts
snippets: Global kernel prices surge by a third as demand for viral cream-filled bars strains supplies
titles: Dubai chocolate sparks pistachio shortage as TikTokers go nuts
summary: Global kernel prices have increased by 33% due to a surge in demand for cream-filled bars that went viral. This demand spike has significantly strained kernel supplies, leading to the price surge.

title: What UnitedHealth Group's Trimmed Profit Forecast Could Mean for Other Insurers
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • UnitedHealth Group's outlook cut Thursday has raised concerns about its insurance peers, with several set to report earnings in the coming weeks. 
  • The company reported first-quarter results that missed estimates, pointing to higher-than-expected medical costs for people enrolled in Medicare plans.
  • Jefferies analysts said Thursday that UnitedHealth's "peers are in trouble" if the company's issues are applicable to insurance rivals.


UnitedHealth Group's (UNH) outlook cut Thursday has raised concerns about its insurance peers, with several set to report earnings in the coming weeks.

The company on Thursday reported first-quarter results that missed estimates, and cut its profit forecast for 2025, pointing to higher-than-expected medical costs for people enrolled in Medicare plans.

UnitedHealth expected claims in its Medicare Advantage business to rise at a similar rate to 2024, but CEO Andrew Witty said in Thursday's earnings call that "indications suggest care activity increased at twice that rate," according to a transcript from AlphaSense.

Jefferies analysts said Thursday that UnitedHealth's "peers are in trouble" if the bellwether's issues are applicable to insurance rivals. However, the analysts said it's also possible UnitedHealth's "expectations were materially more aggressive than peers."

UnitedHealth shares lost over a fifth of their value on Thursday, in their worst day in decades. Other health insurance stocks were dragged down with it, as Humana (HUM) sank more than 7%, Elevance Health (ELV) fell 2.4%, and CVS Health (CVS) slid 1.8%.

Elevance is set to report earnings next Tuesday. Humana is scheduled to release its results the following Wednesday, with CVS's report due a day later.
titles: What UnitedHealth Group's Trimmed Profit Forecast Could Mean for Other Insurers
summary: UnitedHealth Group lowered its profit outlook on Thursday, citing higher-than-expected medical costs for Medicare enrollees, which resulted in its first-quarter earnings missing estimates. This announcement has sparked concerns among investors about the financial health of other insurance companies, as UnitedHealth is considered a bellwether in the industry. Following the news, UnitedHealth's shares plummeted, marking its worst day in decades, and similarly affected stocks of other health insurers like Humana, Elevance Health, and CVS Health. Analysts suggest that if UnitedHealth's issues are

title: Claims of alien life are overhyped – and miss the real accomplishment
snippets: Whenever there’s even a slight chance that an exoplanet shows signs of biological activity, people understandably get excited – but it’s never been aliens, and we shouldn’t jump to conclusions, not this time or the next, says Chris Lintott
titles: Claims of alien life are overhyped – and miss the real accomplishment
summary: Chris Lintott cautions against prematurely concluding that signs of biological activity on exoplanets indicate alien life. He emphasizes the importance of not jumping to conclusions about extraterrestrial life whenever such signs are observed, highlighting that past excitement has never confirmed alien existence.

title: Quantum GPS can help planes navigate when regular GPS is jammed
snippets: A quantum sensor using Earth's magnetic fields outperformed standard GPS backups in test flights. This technology could help commercial aircraft stay on course amid a rise in GPS jamming and spoofing attacks
titles: Quantum GPS can help planes navigate when regular GPS is jammed
summary: A quantum sensor, utilizing Earth's magnetic fields, demonstrated superior performance to traditional GPS backups during test flights. This advancement is significant for commercial aviation, offering a reliable alternative for navigation amidst increasing GPS jamming and spoofing attacks, ensuring aircraft can maintain accurate course.

title: Artificial light pollution could fuel growth of toxic algal blooms
snippets: The "skyglow" produced when light from cities bounces off clouds can help cyanobacteria and other aquatic microbes grow at night
titles: Artificial light pollution could fuel growth of toxic algal blooms
summary: Skyglow, the phenomenon where city lights reflect off clouds, has been found to aid the nocturnal growth of cyanobacteria and other aquatic microbes. This effect allows these organisms to continue their growth processes even during nighttime.

title: A wearable smart insole can track how you walk, run and stand
snippets: A new smart insole system that monitors how people walk in real time could help users improve posture and provide early warnings for conditions from plantar fasciitis to Parkinson's disease.
titles: A wearable smart insole can track how you walk, run and stand
summary: A newly developed smart insole system can monitor walking patterns in real-time, aiding in posture improvement and offering early warnings for various conditions, including plantar fasciitis and Parkinson's disease. This technology aims to enhance user health by identifying and addressing potential issues early.

title: Hot methane seeps could support life beneath Antarctica’s ice sheet
snippets: Microbial communities feeding on geothermal methane seeps beneath the Antarctic ice sheet could resemble life-supporting environments on frozen worlds in our solar system and beyond
titles: Hot methane seeps could support life beneath Antarctica’s ice sheet
summary: Scientists have discovered microbial communities thriving on methane seeps beneath the Antarctic ice sheet, suggesting similar life-supporting environments could exist on frozen worlds within our solar system and beyond. This finding highlights the potential for life in extreme, icy conditions elsewhere in the universe.

summary: Shohei Ohtani, a key player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, has been placed on MLB's paternity list to be with his wife for the birth of their first child. Manager Dave Roberts confirmed Ohtani's absence before the series opener in Texas. Ohtani, 30, had previously announced on Instagram that he and his 28-year-old wife, a former professional basketball player from Japan, were expecting their baby in 2025.
